intro: Charianthus glaberrimus, commonly known as the smoothleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
